benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/pause - Pause a bundle

covered: Valid PUT requests with required and optional parameters (TC01–TC05)
Non-existent resources and invalid bundle identifiers (TC06, TC07, TC20)
Authorization and input validation (missing/invalid header, unauthorized user, invalid bundleId, invalid data) (TC10, TC11, TC06, TC08, TC09, TC12, TC13, TC14, TC17, TC18, TC19)
State handling and error responses for invalid bundle states (paused, canceled) (TC08, TC09)
Security edge cases (SQL injection in bundleId, XSS in headers, extra parameters) (TC13, TC14, TC15, TC24)
Regression tests for special characters and unrelated bundles (TC23, TC24)
gaps: No explicit test for 500 Internal Server Error scenarios (e.g., database failure)
No tests covering 403 Forbidden or broader authorization role scenarios beyond unauthorized (TC11)
No tests validating caching behavior (ETag/Cache-Control) for PUT /pause
No rate-limiting / throttling tests for concurrent bursts
Partial-update semantics are not clearly tested (PUT typically replaces/upates; no explicit partial-update rejection tests)
No explicit idempotency checks beyond concurrent test (TC21)
recommendations: Add a 500 Internal Server Error test to cover database or internal service failures (e.g., simulate DB outage during pause)
Add a test for 403 Forbidden to validate insufficient permissions beyond 401 Unauthorized
Add tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) on PUT responses
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure graceful degradation under burst load
Include explicit idempotency checks (repeat PUT yields same result/status) and clarify PUT vs PATCH semantics
Consider a dedicated test for a 200/204 flow when pausing multiple bundles in bulk, if supported by API
Expand coverage for edge-case inputs not yet explicitly covered (e.g., complex combination of requestedDate and pluginProperty edge cases)
